image.altText: A woman with brown short hair sits behind a microphone

items.synopsis: Senior public servant Kathryn Campbell resigns from the Department of Defence after coming under heavy criticism for her role in the Robodebt scandal.

title.children: Senior public servant in Robodebt scheme resigns from Department of Defence

image.altText: Blue and white police tape at a crime scene.

items.synopsis: Police say the father of the two-year-old boy was "hysterical" when he called police for help, sparking a one-hour search that ended when the boy was found safe and unharmed in a supermarket nearby.

title.children: Father 'hysterical' after car stolen with toddler son inside in Melbourne

image.altText: two public housing towers can be seen with the Melbourne city skyline in the background

items.synopsis: Melbourne public housing tower residents will receive compensation payments of about $2,200 each from the Victorian government after they were forced into a sudden hard lockdown during a COVID-19 outbreak in 2020.

title.children: Melbourne public housing tower residents agree to $5m COVID lockdown settlement

image.altText: Brazilian and Panamanian fans smile at the camera as they hoild their national flags in the stands before a game.

items.synopsis: Germany gets off to a flying start with a big win over Morocco in Melbourne - next up is Brazil vs Panama after Italy takes the points earlier in the day against Argentina. Follow along in our live blog.

title.children: Germany crushes Morocco in Melbourne, Brazil - Panama to wrap up the day at the Women's World Cup

liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Brazil vs Panama is underway in Adelaide!

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: I think I counted right? Seriously though, not a great result in a World Cup where we've seen a narrowing of the gap betwen the heavyweights and the minnows. A huge statement from Germany, though, and strengthening the case of people like me who think they're the favourites here. Here's how Kate O'Halloran saw the game in Melbourne. It took just 23 seconds for the dam wall to break. For a half of football, Morocco held on gallantly. They may have trailed 0-2 at the break, but the underdogs had created a number of chances, and looked up for the fight. Within just half a minute of the restart, however, Klara Buehl made a dangerous run on the left hand side, delivering an excellent, floating cross to the back post. It was Buehl herself who ended up converting the shot from 7m out, breaking Moroccan hearts, as well as their resistance. By the 48th minute, the world number two ranked side looked to be toying with their opponents. Brand was able to walk a ball up to the box, before she passed to Magull, who nonchalantly left it for Buehl. The midfielder’s powerful strike missed, careering into the right-hand post, but it kickstarted a series of relentless efforts on goal for which the Atlas Lionesses appeared to have no answer. Two own goals followed, the latter at first looking like a Popp hattrick. Then, as full-time approached, the ruthless Germans scored again, this time through substitute Lea Schueller. In the end, the scoreline reflected the 70-place chasm between them; a contest between the world number 2 versus 72.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: FULL-TIME: Germany 6 - 0 Morocco

children.content: Seriously though, not a great result in a World Cup where we've seen a narrowing of the gap betwen the heavyweights and the minnows.
A huge statement from Germany, though, and strengthening the case of people like me who think they're the favourites here.
It took just 23 seconds for the dam wall to break.
For a half of football, Morocco held on gallantly. They may have trailed 0-2 at the break, but the underdogs had created a number of chances, and looked up for the fight.
Within just half a minute of the restart, however, Klara Buehl made a dangerous run on the left hand side, delivering an excellent, floating cross to the back post.
It was Buehl herself who ended up converting the shot from 7m out, breaking Moroccan hearts, as well as their resistance.

By the 48th minute, the world number two ranked side looked to be toying with their opponents. Brand was able to walk a ball up to the box, before she passed to Magull, who nonchalantly left it for Buehl.
The midfielder’s powerful strike missed, careering into the right-hand post, but it kickstarted a series of relentless efforts on goal for which the Atlas Lionesses appeared to have no answer.
Two own goals followed, the latter at first looking like a Popp hattrick.
Then, as full-time approached, the ruthless Germans scored again, this time through substitute Lea Schueller.
In the end, the scoreline reflected the 70-place chasm between them; a contest between the world number 2 versus 72.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Lea Schuller has her 32nd goal for Germany after pouncing on a rebound from the keeper and smashing it into the back of the net. Nine additional minutes (of torture) for Morocco.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 90' GOAL Germany - that makes 6

children.content: Lea Schuller has her 32nd goal for Germany after pouncing on a rebound from the keeper and smashing it into the back of the net.
Nine additional minutes (of torture) for Morocco.

image.altText: Sam Kerr with a bandage on her left calf at a Matildas training session in Brisbane.

items.synopsis: The extent of Sam Kerr's injury remains a mystery after Matildas youngster Kyra Cooney-Cross caused a brief panic by mistakenly saying her teammate had torn her calf.

title.children: Matildas play down panic over Kerr injury after teammate's slip of the tongue

image.altText: Gladys Berejiklian looking serious.

items.synopsis: ICAC inspector Gail Furness SC has written to former treasurer Matt Kean to advise him of the investigation after he wrote a letter complaining about the former premier's treatment last month, the ABC understands.

title.children: ICAC chief to probe delay in Gladys Berejiklian report, possible maladministration

image.altText: Gina Rinehart smiles while standing in front of cattle pens

items.synopsis: The descendants of late mining magnate Peter Wright claim they are entitled to a bigger share of iron ore royalties based on an agreement struck with Lang Hancock in the 1970s, the WA Supreme Court hears.

title.children: Here's what happened on day one of the long-awaited showdown between mining heiresses

image.altText: A police car and road closure signs on a highway.

items.synopsis: Police believe the two vehicles collided just after 1pm on the Murray Valley Highway in north-west Victoria, while in a separate incident in Mildura, two officers suffered minor injuries after their van was hit by a car at a busy intersection.

title.children: Man dies, second in hospital after Murray Valley Highway collision at Mystic Park

image.altText: Cael O'Donnell stands in a graveyard

items.synopsis: Scammers are using popular psychics' identities to trick people out of money on social media. Scamwatch is warning Australians to be vigilant online.

title.children: Rise in online scammers posing as psychics preying on Australian believers

image.altText: A ambulance is parked at the Alfred Hospital.

items.synopsis: Frontline emergency workers have accused one of Victoria's busiest hospitals of not meeting legally-mandated nurse-to-patient ratios, which they claim is putting the sickest patients at risk.

title.children: One of Victoria's busiest hospitals is understaffing its emergency department, nurses say

image.altText: a skyline with houses

items.synopsis: A new report from campaign group Everybody's Home finds 80 per cent of renters are spending more than a third of their income on housing.

title.children: Majority of Australians living under 'housing stress', survey finds

image.altText: white crystals in containers and plastic bags sitting on a table

items.synopsis: The court heard that Ryan Mays was a passenger in his own car during March 2021 when police stopped the vehicle and found drugs hidden under the glove box.

title.children: Judge jails Perth drug dealer for six years over meth, MDMA bust in Broome

image.altText: qvm-historic-photo-1st-arrivals-xmas-1907-400

items.synopsis: Every day thousands of tourists and shoppers park their cars, then tread over the remains of the dead at Melbourne's Queen Victoria Market.

title.children: Every day, thousands of people walk over a burial ground at one of Melbourne's biggest tourist attractions

image.altText: A teenage girl with blonde hair holds a mobile phone with both hands, with the phone in focus and her face obscured.

items.synopsis: A Mildura man has pleaded guilty to child exploitation and the transmission of child abuse material by encouraging a person in Thailand to send him illegal content.

title.children: Victorian man pleads guilty to seeking violent sex abuse images from source in Thailand

image.altText: smiling older man looking at camera

items.synopsis: Good Samaritan Terry Bishop had been travelling to Brisbane on Friday to attend a family member's wedding. Family members say he was a man who would go out of his way to help anyone.

title.children: 'Absolutely devastated': Bruce Highway triple-fatal victim Terry Bishop had been travelling to family wedding

image.altText: A crashed car against a barrier with police attending.

items.synopsis: A man who police allege stole a car before it was involved in a triple fatal crash on the Sunshine Coast has more driving charges laid against him.

title.children: Driver hit with more charges after horror Queensland highway crash killed three

image.altText: A man in a bucket hat rubs his face in frustration.

items.synopsis: England captain Ben Stokes says anyone who believes the team should have declared earlier at Old Trafford 'doesn't understand the game', as Australia retain the Ashes.

title.children: Stokes bristles at declaration critics and reveals his one regret as England fail to claim the Ashes back

image.altText: An aerial photo showing a Navy ship in the open ocean, with a military jet flying overhead.

items.synopsis: An aerial photograph obtained by the ABC shows an RAAF P-8 Poseidon plane flying over a Chinese surveillance ship as it headed towards Australia last week.

title.children: First image emerges of Australia's encounter with Chinese spy ship

image.altText: An illustration of a woman crouched on a hospital bed with her head in her arms

items.synopsis: Too many women are leaving mental health units in a worse condition than when they arrived, with some in mixed-gender wards reporting shocking treatment that has left them reluctant to seek further care.

title.children: When Maree was sexually assaulted in a mental health unit, staff responded by telling her to stay on her bed

image.altText: Wicks is standing in her place, holding a piece of paper and looking towards the Speaker (not in shot).

items.synopsis: The former federal MP for Robertson names herself at the centre of allegations about alleged abuse by a "NSW member of parliament spanning more than 5 years".

title.children: Liberal Party figure Lucy Wicks claims she received hundreds of 'abusive' texts from NSW MP

image.altText: Iceberg in the Southern Ocean, seen from a ship.

items.synopsis: Antarctic sea ice has usually been able to recover in winter. But this time it's different, with levels taking a sharp downward turn at a time of year when sea ice usually forms reliably — and experts are worried.

title.children: A once in every 7.5 million year event is unfolding in the Antarctic. And it has scientists scrambling for answers

image.altText: A man holds his daughter as he walks up a stone road followed by other tourists evacuating the island of Rhodes

items.synopsis: Fires burning since last week have forced the evacuation of at least 19,000 people from Greece's popular tourist islands.

title.children: Flights out of Greek islands begin as fires continue

image.altText: Woman with short hair looks upset while wearing black suit

items.synopsis: The justice minister says she was facing "personal difficulties" when she allegedly crashed into a parked car.

title.children: New Zealand minister resigns after crash while allegedly over alcohol limit

image.altText: A night time photo of a Queensland Police Service car with its blue light illuminated.

items.synopsis: Queensland Police Commissioner Katarina Carroll says a small cohort of offenders are committing more crime and and it's more violent than before.

title.children: 'Phenomenal' arrest figures as 14,000 charges laid in Queensland police operation targetting young offenders

image.altText: Three women in bright coloured dresses walk along Romes streets with foldable fans

items.synopsis: Record breaking high temperatures are set to continue for Europe and the US in August, experts warn.

title.children: Here's what we know about extreme heat continuing to grip much of the world

image.altText: Stan Grant appears on Q+A.

items.synopsis: Veteran host Stan Grant has decided to step away from presenting Q+A. Patricia Karvelas will continue as host of the program for the rest of the year.

title.children: Stan Grant departs from Q+A

image.altText: A man in a high-vis jumper stands next to pallets with logs piled in the background.

items.synopsis: Timber milling is an intergenerational lifeline in Corryong. Many residents will be impacted by the state government's recent acceleration of the end of native timber harvesting, tipped for the end of the year.

title.children: In one of Victoria's most isolated towns the sawmill industry is shutting down, and locals are worried

image.altText: A mother sits on a black leather couch with her arms around her two young children.

items.synopsis: This refugee mother has waited for more than a decade to be reunited with her older children. Learning she'll have to wait a few more years has been devastating.

title.children: 'I need my children': Susan has spent 11 years fighting to be reunited with her two older children

image.altText: A young woman with red hair is comforted by an older blonde woman

items.synopsis: A 20-year-old has different priorities in life than an 80-year-old. So why do we assume their priorities in death are the same?

title.children: Why young people with life-limiting illnesses need special end-of-life care

image.altText: An aerial view of wreckage of a school gymnasium in China

items.synopsis: Chinese state media reports a volcanic glass roof over a school gym collapsed, trapping a female volleyball team, with the heads of the company who installed the roof taken into custody.

title.children: Entire school gym roof collapses, killing 11 and trapping one

image.altText: bales of redcycle plastics at replas site in ballarat

items.synopsis: New research reveals the extent of Australia's single-use plastic waste, as global leaders "negotiate" over a plastics treaty.

title.children: Australia risks mismanaging 100k tonnes of plastic as researchers warn of pollution crisis

image.altText: A black and white image of crowns being placed on a man and woman's heads

items.synopsis: Juan Carlos was once a handsome young king who saved Spain from tyranny. Now disgraced and living in exile, his son Felipe dreads his potential return.

title.children: 'Always embarrassed by his father': Why Spain's King Felipe is dreading his disgraced dad's return
